__NOTOC__ {{Infobox church |name = Grange Fell Church |image = |caption = |dedication = |denomination = [[Church of England]] |churchmanship = [[Anglicanism|Anglican]] |diocese = [[Diocese of Carlisle]] |province = [[Province of York]] |vicar = Revd. Canon Nicholas Ash |curate = |curate1 = |organistdom = |organist = |warden = |warden1 = |website = [http://www.achurchnearyou.com/grange-fell-church/ Grange Fell Church, Grange-over-Sands] |logo = }} '''Grange Fell Church''' commonly referred to by locals as '''The Fell Church''' is a [[Church of England]] church in the Grange Fell area of [[Grange-Over-Sands]], [[Cumbria]], England. It was built in 1907. Its [[benefice#Church of England|benefice]] is united with those of [[St Mary's Church, Allithwaite|St Mary, Allithwiate]], [[Cartmel Priory|St Mary and St Michael, Cartmel]], [[St Peter's Church, Field Broughton|St Peter, Field Broughton]], St John the Baptist, Flookburgh, [[St Paul Parish Church, Grange-over-Sands|St Paul, Grange-over-Sands]], and St Paul, Lindale.<ref>{{Citation | url = http://www.achurchnearyou.com/grange-fell-church/| title = Grange Fell Church, Grange-over-Sands| accessdate = 18 November 2011| publisher = [[Church of England]]}}</ref>
==History== A Parish Magazine of 1898 states "an afternoon service at the Church room on Grange Fell has been recommenced for the winter months". This 'room' was in the home of Mrs Nell Smith who provided accommodation so people in the area could worship regularly. The Present Building was built in 1907, it was dedicated on 26 April 1907 year by the then Bishop of Carlisle, Rt Revd Dr Diggle. <ref>[http://www.grangepcc.homecall.co.uk/fell.htm Fell Church Grange PCC]</ref>
==Today== The church is part of the [[Diocese of Carlisle]], Archdeaconry of Westmorland & Furness and the Deanery of [[Windermere]]. inside [[Windermere]] it is part of the parish of St. Paul Grange-Over-Sands along with [[St Paul Parish Church, Grange-over-Sands|St Paul Parish Church]] in the Town Centre, both of which share the same vicar who is currently The Revd. Canon Nicholas Ash.<ref>[http://www.carlislediocese.org.uk/churches/deaneries/windermere.html Diocese of Carlisle]</ref>
There is also a cemetery called Grange Fell Cemetery a short distance away.
